c74object.name: jcom.parameter
c74object.description: Handling parameters in Jamoma modules. The state of the parameters define the state of the Jamoma module. The parameter state can be queried, stored and recalled, enabling storing and recalling of module presets, as well as other mechanisms for monitoring and controlling the state of the module.

Increment parameter value in steps. It takes the following arguments:
• int/float: How many steps to increase by. Stepsize is defined by the value/stepsize attribute (optional, defauls to 1).
• symbol: The symbol ramp indicates that jcom.parameter should ramp to the new value (optional).
• int/float: The time interval of the ramp (optional, defaults to 0).
The message + is a shortcut or alias for the OSC message value/inc.

Decrease parameter value in steps. It takes the following arguments:
• int/float: How many steps to decrease by. Stepsize is defined by the value/stepsize attribute (optional, defauls to 1).
• symbol: The symbol ramp indicates that jcom.parameter should ramp to the new value (optional).
• int/float: The time interval of the ramp (optional, defaults to 0).
The message - is a shortcut or alias for the OSC message value/dec .

method.name: dispatched
method.description: The dispatched message is used by the Jamoma system for intenal communication from the hub (jcom.hub) of the module to the parameter. One of the benefits of this is that the parameter can be accessed not only locally by direct communication with jcom.parameter, but also from outside the module by passing OSC messages to the left inlet of the module with the OSC name of the module prepended to the OSC namespace: /parameter_name/parameter_namespace. In addition the parameter can be controlled by other modules such as jmod.cuelist and jmod.cont_mapper using OSC addresses with the name of the module and parameter prepended: /module_name/parameter_name/parameter_namespace.

method.name: dump
method.description: The dump message can be used for debugging of the parameter, and dumps the current state of the object to the Max window.

method.name: ui/refresh
method.description: Outputs current value with set prepended from left outlet only in order to refresh displayed value in the GUI.

method.name: value/dec
method.description:
Decrease parameter value in steps. It takes the following arguments:
• int/float: How many steps to decrease by. Stepsize is defined by the value/stepsize attribute (optional, defauls to 1).
• symbol: The symbol ramp indicates that jcom.parameter should ramp to the new value (optional).
• int/float: The time interval of the ramp (optional, defaults to 0).
value/dec can also be addressed by the shortcut -.

method.description:
Increment parameter value in steps. It takes the following arguments:
• int/float: How many steps to increase by. Stepsize is defined by the value/stepsize attribute (optional, defauls to 1).
• symbol: The symbol ramp indicates that jcom.parameter should ramp to the new value (optional).
• int/float: The time interval of the ramp (optional, defaults to 0).
value/inc can also be addressed by the shortcut +.

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Set the type of data stored and handled by the parameter. Options are msg_generic, msg_int, msg_float, msg_symbol, msg_toggle, msg_list and msg_none.
attribute.description:
Set the type of data stored and handled by the parameter. Options are:
• msg_float: The parameter is a container for a floating-point value.
• msg_generic: The parameter can contain an array with one or more integers, floating-point numbers and/or symbols.
• msg_int: The parameter is a container for an integer value.
• msg_list: The parameter is a container for a list. Currently all list members are assumed to be of type int or float.
• msg_none: The parameter does not conatin any value. In this case it makes more sense to use jcom.message with the type attribute set to msg_none, as there's no state that can be queried, stored or recalled.
• msg_symbol: The parameter is a container for a symbol.
• msg_toggle: The parameter is a container for a boolean (1/0) value.

entry.name: (internal)
entry.description: jcom.parameter communicates with jcom.hub so that parameters can be updated and communicated remotely, as well as being passed on to the algorithm of the module via jcom.in or jcom.in~. In addition the internal communication ensures proper communication with other modules monitoring and controlling changes in all modules of the Jamoma network.

entry.name: Communication with the module via the hub
entry.description:
Internal communication between jcom.hub and jcom.parameter enables communication with the parameter by passing OSC messages to the left inlet of the hub or module. The parameter can be addressed by OSC messages to the module with the name of the parameter as OSC address, eventually with ramping over a specified time interval:
• /name_of_parameter (value)
• /name_of_parameter (value) ramp 3000
The parameter is concieved as a node of the OSC namespace as elaborated in T. Place et al (2008): Addressing Classes by Differentiating Values and Properties in OSC. Procceedings of NIME 2008.
All messages and attributes that can be accessed locally are therefore also accessible using the colon separator “:” as a separator between the OSC address of the node and the namespace for adressing the members of the node, e.g:
• /parameter_name:+
• /parameter_name:dataspace temperature
• /parameter_name:dataspace/unit/active Celsius

entry.name: Remote communication to and from other modules
entry.description:
The Jamoma framework also have a system for listening to and controlling parameters, messages and returns of modules remoetely. This enables modules to control other modules using OSC messages with the name of the module and the name of the parameter prepended to the local namespace of the node. Some examples of modules using this feature are jmod.cuelist, jmod.mapper, jmod.cont_mapper and jmod.trig_mapper.
Here are some examples illustrating the syntax used for addressing a parameter from e.g. the cuelist of jmod.cuescript:
• /module_name/parameter_name (value)
• /module_name/parameter_name (value) ramp 3000
• /module_name/parameter_name:+
• /module_name/parameter_name:dataspace temperature
• /module_name/parameter_name:dataspace/unit/active Celsius
